file_name: IntegrityFunds_20200121_485BPOS_EX-99.E UNDR CONTR_11948727_EX-99.E UNDR CONTR_Service Agreement.txt

perturbation.original_text: The Fund's agreement to indemnify Integrity, its officers and governors, and any such controlling person, as aforesaid, is expressly conditioned upon the Fund's being notified of any action brought against Integrity, its officers or governors, or any such controlling person, such notification to be given by letter or by telegram addressed to the Fund at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, and sent to the Fund by the person against whom such action is brought, within ten days after the summons or other first legal process shall have been served.
perturbation.changed_text: The Fund's agreement to indemnify Integrity, its officers and governors, and any such controlling person, as aforesaid, is expressly conditioned upon the Fund's being notified of any action brought against Integrity, its officers or governors, or any such controlling person, such notification to be given by letter or by telegram addressed to the Fund at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, and sent to the Fund by the person against whom such action is brought, within three days after the summons or other first legal process shall have been served.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notification period to three days is an inconsistency because it may not provide sufficient time for the indemnified party to adequately assess the claim and notify the indemnifying party, potentially violating due process or fair notice principles implied in law. This may also be considered commercially unreasonable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied principles of due process and commercially reasonable standards.

perturbation.original_text: Integrity's agreement to indemnify the Fund, its officers and trustees, and any such controlling person, as aforesaid, is expressly conditioned upon Integrity's being notified of any action brought against the Fund, its officers or trustees, or any such controlling person, such notification to be given by letter or telegram addressed to Integrity at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, and sent to Integrity by the person against whom such action is brought, within ten days after the summons or other first legal process shall have been served.
perturbation.changed_text: Integrity's agreement to indemnify the Fund, its officers and trustees, and any such controlling person, as aforesaid, is expressly conditioned upon Integrity's being notified of any action brought against the Fund, its officers or trustees, or any such controlling person, such notification to be given by letter or telegram addressed to Integrity at its principal office in Minot, North Dakota, and sent to Integrity by the person against whom such action is brought, within one day after the summons or other first legal process shall have been served.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notification period to one day is an inconsistency because it is an unreasonably short time frame to notify the indemnifying party to adequately assess the claim. It may violate due process or fair notice principles implied in law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied principles of due process and commercially reasonable standards.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement is terminable with respect to the Fund, without penalty, (a) on 60 days' written notice, by vote of a majority of the Qualified Trustees or by vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the outstanding voting securities of the Fund or (b) on 90 days' written notice by Integrity.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement is terminable with respect to the Fund, without penalty, (a) on 10 days' written notice, by vote of a majority of the Qualified Trustees or by vote of a majority (as defined in the 1940 Act) of the outstanding voting securities of the Fund or (b) on 10 days' written notice by Integrity.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the termination notice period to 10 days introduces an inconsistency. This significantly shortens the time frame for either party to wind down operations, secure alternative arrangements, or address potential disruptions. This could be deemed unreasonable under common law principles, especially given the complexities involved in fund distribution agreements.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law principles of reasonable notice in contract termination.
